short_summary: Acquisition of up to 80 housing units, concurrent construction and management of residential housing at CFB Edmonton
description: This is a Request for Information (RFI) from the Department of National Defence (DND) for potential suppliers of residential investment opportunities for Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Edmonton. The purpose is to ascertain whether housing units are available for acquisition and/or interest in constructing and managing residential housing exists.

full_summary:
**Request for Information: Canadian Forces Base Edmonton, AB**

**Tender Information:**

* **Solicitation Number:** Y6800_ED
* **Request for Information (RFI) Date:** October 12, 2023
* **Closing Date and Time:** November 2, 2023, at 14:00:00 hours
* **Contracting Entity:**
	+ Defence Construction Canada / Construction de Défense Canada
	+ Address: 350 Albert St, 19th floor, Ottawa, ON K1A 0K3, Canada
* **Contact:**
	+ Steve Kennedy, Technical Specialist, Procurement
	+ Phone: 613-769-2659
	+ Email: steve.kennedy@dcc-cdc.gc.ca

**Purpose and Scope:**

The purpose of this Request for Information (RFI) is to determine potential interest and opportunities in supporting the Department of National Defence (DND) at Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Edmonton, AB. This RFI is non-binding and not a bid solicitation. Respondents are advised that no expenses incurred in responding to this RFI will be reimbursed.

**Description of the Program and Services:**

DND is seeking residential investment opportunities and inviting interested parties to submit responses to this RFI. The RFI aims to confirm whether housing units are available for acquisition and/or whether there is interest in constructing and/or managing residential housing for DND's activities at CFB Edmonton. Up to 80 housing units within a specified geographic boundary may be acquired. Undeveloped land is also available for consideration.

**Submission Requirements:**

Firms that consider themselves qualified to provide these services are invited to submit their responses to the RFI by email on or before the closing date and time. The submission requirements are outlined in the RFI document. This RFI is conditional on the projects receiving approval to proceed by the Department of National Defence (DND).

**Questions:**

Any questions relating to this Request for Information can be addressed to Steve Kennedy, Technical Specialist, Procurement. Bidding and documents are available on http://www.merx.com. Fees may apply; visit https://www.merx.com/public/pricing for more information.

Note: I have removed irrelevant information and reformatted the text to improve clarity and professionalism. I have also condensed the text to fit within the 400-word limit. Let me know if you have any further requests!
